hints.label: ex-thermalization-paths
hints.title: Thermalization Path Analysis
hints.content:
2429: :label: ex-thermalization-paths
2430: 
2431: **Setup:**
2432: - $\mathcal{X} = [-5, 5]^2$ (2D box)
2433: - $U(x) = \frac{1}{2}\|x\|^2$ (harmonic potential)
2434: - Initial: $\rho_0 = \text{Unif}([-5,5]^2)$
2435: - Parameters: $\gamma = 1$, $\sigma_v = 1$, $N = 1000$
2436: 
2437: **Observables:**
2438: 
2439: 1. **Mean action vs. time:**
2440: 
2441: 
2442: $$
2443: \langle S_{\text{OM}}(0 \to t) \rangle = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N S_{\text{OM}}[\gamma_i|_{[0,t]}]
2444: $$
2445: 
2446:    **Prediction:** Decreases as $t \to \infty$, approaching the equilibrium action.
2447: 
2448: 2. **Entropy production:**
2449: 
2450: 
2451: $$
2452: \Sigma(t) = \frac{2}{\sigma_v^2} \langle S_{\text{OM}}(0 \to t) \rangle
2453: $$
2454: 
2455:    **Prediction:** $\Sigma(t) \sim t$ initially (far from equilibrium), then saturates.
2456: 
2457: 3. **KL divergence to QSD:**
2458: 
2459: 
2460: $$
2461: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_{\text{QSD}}) = \int \rho_t \log \frac{\rho_t}{\rho_{\text{QSD}}} d\mu
2462: $$
2463: 
2464:    **Connection to action:** From Chapter 10, $D_{\text{KL}}$ decays exponentially with rate $\lambda_{\text{LSI}}$ (LSI constant). The path action encodes this decay.
2465: 
2466: **Numerical Results:**
2467: 
2468: (To be computed with Algorithm {prf:ref}`alg-action-estimation`)
2469: 
2470: **Expected Behavior:**
2471: - $\langle S \rangle(t)$ starts high (far from typical equilibrium paths), then decreases

hints.label: ex-exploration-exploitation-transition
hints.title: Action-Based Detection of E-E Transition
hints.content:
2481: :label: ex-exploration-exploitation-transition
2482: 
2483: **Setup:**
2484: - Run Adaptive Gas with varying $\alpha \in [0, 2]$ (other parameters fixed)
2485: - Record swarm trajectories for each $\alpha$
2486: - Compute:
2487:   1. Mean action $\langle S(\alpha) \rangle$
2488:   2. Action fluctuations $\text{Var}(S(\alpha))$
2489:   3. Path space curvature $R_{\mathcal{P}}(\alpha)$ (via {prf:ref}`def-path-space-curvature`)
2490: 
2491: **Predictions:**
2492: 
2493: - **Exploration phase** ($\alpha \ll 1$): High action (diffusive paths), low curvature
2494: - **Exploitation phase** ($\alpha \gg 1$): Low action (deterministic toward fitness), high curvature
2495: - **Critical point** ($\alpha_c \approx 0.5 - 1$):
2496:   - $\text{Var}(S)$ peaks (maximum path diversity)
2497:   - $R_{\mathcal{P}} \to \infty$ (curvature divergence, analogous to Ruppeiner metric)
2498: 
2499: **Connection to Chapter 22:**
2500: 
2501: At QSD, the Ruppeiner curvature $R_{\text{Rupp}}$ detects thermodynamic phase transitions. Here, the path space curvature $R_{\mathcal{P}}$ detects **dynamical** phase transitions during transient evolution.
2502: 
2503: **Observables:**
2504: 
2505: $$
2506: \chi_S(\alpha) := \frac{\partial \langle S(\alpha) \rangle}{\partial \alpha}
2507: $$

hints.label: ex-variational-annealing
hints.title: Variational Annealing
hints.content:
2517: :label: ex-variational-annealing
2518: 
2519: **Goal:** Find $T^*(t)$ minimizing total action to reach target state.
2520: 
2521: **Formulation:**
2522: 
2523: Minimize:
2524: 
2525: $$
2526: J[T(\cdot)] = \int_0^{T_{\text{final}}} S_{\text{OM}}[\gamma; T(t)] dt
2527: $$
2528: 
2529: subject to $\gamma(T_{\text{final}}) = x_{\text{target}}$.
2530: 
2531: **Optimal Control Solution:**
2532: 
2533: Using Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equation ({prf:ref}`thm-hjb-equation-fragile-gas`), the optimal temperature satisfies:
2534: 
2535: $$
2536: T^*(t) = \frac{\sigma_v^2}{\gamma} \sqrt{\frac{\|\nabla U_{\text{eff}}(x_t)\|}{\lambda_{\text{min}}(\nabla^2 U_{\text{eff}}(x_t))}}
2537: $$
2538: 
2539: where $\lambda_{\min}$ is the smallest eigenvalue of the Hessian (most unstable direction).
2540: 
2541: **Physical Interpretation:**
2542: 
2543: - Near saddle points ($\lambda_{\min} \approx 0$): Increase $T$ (more noise to escape)
2544: - Near minima ($\lambda_{\min} \gg 0$): Decrease $T$ (less noise to settle)
2545: 
2546: **Implementation:**
2547: 
2548: Use Algorithm {prf:ref}`alg-action-estimation` to evaluate $J[T]$ for candidate schedules, then optimize via gradient descent on schedule space.
2549: 
2550: **Comparison to Geometric Annealing:**

hints.label: ex-yang-mills-thermalization
hints.title: YM Vacuum State Thermalization
hints.content:
2560: :label: ex-yang-mills-thermalization
2561: 
2562: **Setup:**
2563: 
2564: - Fractal Set lattice with $N_{\text{sites}} \sim 10^3$
2565: - Yang-Mills action $S_{\text{YM}}[A] = \frac{1}{4g^2}\sum_{\text{plaq}} \text{Tr}(F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu})$
2566: - Initialize with random gauge field $A_0$
2567: - Evolve with Langevin dynamics:
2568: 
2569: 
2570: $$
2571: \frac{dA_\mu}{dt} = -\frac{\delta S_{\text{YM}}}{\delta A_\mu} - \gamma A_\mu + \sqrt{2\gamma T} \, \xi_\mu
2572: $$
2573: 
2574: **Path Space Observables:**
2575: 
2576: 1. **Yang-Mills Action Trajectory:**
2577: 
2578: 
2579: $$
2580: S_{\text{YM}}(t) = S_{\text{YM}}[A_t]
2581: $$
2582: 
2583:    Decays from $S_{\text{YM}}(0) \sim \infty$ (random) to $S_{\text{YM}}(\infty) \sim 0$ (vacuum).
2584: 
2585: 2. **Onsager-Machlup Action for YM:**
2586: 
2587: 
2588: $$
2589: S_{\text{OM}}^{\text{YM}}[\gamma] = \int_0^T \frac{1}{2\sigma^2} \left\| \frac{dA_\mu}{dt} + \frac{\delta S_{\text{YM}}}{\delta A_\mu} + \gamma A_\mu \right\|^2 dt
2590: $$
2591: 
2592: 3. **Instantons:**
2593: 
2594:    Tunneling events between topologically distinct vacua (characterized by Chern-Simons number) appear as action spikes.
2595: 
2596: **Analysis:**
2597: 
2598: - Plot $S_{\text{OM}}^{\text{YM}}(t)$ vs. topological charge $Q(t)$
2599: - Identify instanton transitions as local maxima of action
2600: - Compute instanton rate: $\Gamma_{\text{inst}} = \frac{N_{\text{inst}}}{T_{\text{total}}}$
2601: 
2602: **Connection to Millennium Prize:**
2603: 
2604: The thermalization dynamics provide a computational probe of the **mass gap**:
2605: 
2606: $$
2607: \Delta_{\text{YM}} = \inf_{\text{excited}} [E_{\text{excited}} - E_{\text{vacuum}}]
2608: $$
2609: 
2610: The relaxation time $\tau_{\text{relax}}$ is related to $\Delta_{\text{YM}}$ via:
2611: 
2612: $$
2613: \tau_{\text{relax}} \sim \frac{1}{\Delta_{\text{YM}}}
2614: $$
